title: Short-Term Overseas Language Study and Service Learning Project: Strengthening Science Education Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and basic English communication skills
context.additional_context: Learners design and operate a science-based camp for local middle school students by combining short-term overseas language study with service learning. The project is conducted using digital collaboration tools via personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners achieve a 20% or greater improvement in self-assessed English communication proficiency (measured by CAN-DO statements) before and after overseas training.
Learners directly design and implement three science principle-based experiential activities for local middle school students.

Learners identify at least two customer service issues in teams of 3–4 at a service-learning site (e.g., community event support), apply the scientific inquiry method (observation–hypothesis–experiment–conclusion) to propose solutions, and achieve a rating of "average" or higher in at least three out of five evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, collaborative attitude) based on peer and teacher assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
